text:
- Hi everyone and welcome
to another episode

of Business Builders
where I am joined today

by Bryn Newell, who is
the CTO of Eightcap,
an Australian based derivatives
and broking trading platform.
Bryn, welcome.
Thank you so much for joining us.
I would love to hear more about
your journey building Eightcap
and how you have built the product

that's really differentiated
you guys in the market.
- Thanks for having me, Anna.
It's great to be here.
Eightcap competes on 3 key pillars being
price, education, and technology.
So our fees, our spreads
are some of the best in the industry.
On the education side of things,
we have a number of market experts
who provide key insights to traders,
incumbent expert traders,

but also new traders
entering the marketplace.

And on the technology side
that it's really important

that we have a stable
platform, a reliable platform,

and platform that can
perform for our customers.
- Super interested to hear
what the recent volatility

in world markets has
done for your platform.

How has that affected
trading platforms generally?
- It's had a huge impact.
Market volatility,

driven through geopolitical
situations at the moment,

speculation around interest
rate rises and inflation,

all of these things have
driven a lot of volatility.

The price fluctuations
are a really good option

for individuals to take
advantage of the market.

So it's really driven
an increase of traders
across our platform.
Over the last 6 to 9 months

we've seen approximately
20,000 new accounts open.
- Bryn, that's just amazing growth.
So congratulations to you and your team
on being able to achieve that.
And obviously my next question is,
as the CTO how did you get your systems
to keep up with that growth?
- Throughout COVID,

we migrated all of our
systems to the cloud to AWS,
so that was paramount to setting us up
for this customer growth.

Being on premises it wasn't
something that would support it.
Moving to the cloud enabled us
to really support our customer base
from a capacity perspective.

But not only that, something
that's often overlooked is

it's important when you're
growing your customer base

they're usually growing
geographically as well

and that's definitely
what happened at Eightcap.
So it was an opportunity for us

to put out infrastructure
closer to the customer.
So as you grow your customer base,

as you grow products
you are more vulnerable.
From an endpoint perspective,
our laptops that we have in the office
all the way through to our infrastructure
is completely protected.
- Let's go a bit deeper
on actually your use of the technology

because I know that your
team are actually using data
and insights quite differently.
- We aggregate all of our information
across all of our tools
into what we call a data lake,
and that information is then able

to service all different
parts of our business.

So the customer service
team now have insights
around why the customers are trading,
when they're trading,

what particular instruments
they're trading,
and we have information around the tooling

as far as what age group are
more likely to use these tools,
all demographic instruments.

So we're able to then overlay
these on top of each other

and give personalized
experience to our customers.
But we can see that our retention rate
has increased from 6 to 8%.
And on the fraud side of things
our risk team have been able
to flag a number of transactions
which were potential fraud,
investigate those further.
And some of the savings that we've seen,
there's been a direct impact on P&L.
We're looking at in the hundreds
of thousands over the 2022 period.

- It really is an end to end
cloud technology success story.
So I guess my next question is
what else can we help you with?
What comes next for Eightcap

and how do you want to be using
technology for the future?
- [Bryn] We're looking at growing
the incumbent customer base experience.
We're looking at a B2B offering as well,
which will diversify our customer base,
so that'll grow as well.
But I really think it's doubling down
on the data side of things,

really moving into some
of the machine learning
and running some of these models

where we're able to
automate and reduce costs
and speed up some of our processes.

- It's a delight to be
able to speak to you

and hear more about the
success of your business.
Thank you.
